pages.text: $(li)A normal Jar can store 4 Buckets, 12 Bottles, or 6 Bowls of any fluid, including honey, milk, potions, soups, stews, dragon breath, and XP from bottle-o-enchanting.
$(li)You can save Experience in a Jar right clicking it while you are holding a Bottle of Experience in your hand.
$(li)You can save Water in a Jar right clicking it while you are holding a Water Bottle in your hand.
$(li)You can save Lava in a Jar right clicking it while you are holding a Lava Bottle in your hand.
$(li)You can save Milk in a Jar right clicking it while you are holding a Milk Bottle in your hand.
$(li)You can save Mushroom and Rabbit Stews in a Jar right clicking it while you are holding a in your hand.
$(li)You can save Dragon Breath in a Jar right clicking it while you are holding a Dragon's Breath bottle in your hand.
$(li)You can capture small aquatic creatures in a Jar like fishes in a Jar while you are holding a Jar in your hand.
$(li)You can save capture Fireflies in a Jar right clicking them while you are holding a Jar in your hand.
$(li)Jars can also store Cookies and Candies too.
$(li)A Tinted Jar works like the normal Jars.$(br)$(li)They can capture specific small dangerous creatures.
$(li)You can capture Slimes in Jars, right clicking on one of them while you are holding a Jar in your hand.
$(li)You can capture Vexes in Jars, right clicking on one of them while you are holding a Jar in your hand.
$(li)You can capture Endermites in Jars, right clicking on one of them while you are holding a Jar in your hand.
